alert.note: Alert for Coffee; Dale; Geneva; Houston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 09 at 7:15PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Dale, southeastern Coffee, northeastern Geneva and northwestern Houston Counties through 800 PM CDT... At 714 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near New Brockton to near Pinckard. Movement was south at 10 mph. At 653 PM CDT, the Cairns Army Airfield measured a wind gust of 41 mph. HAZARD...Winds between 30 mph and 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Daleville, Enterprise, Dothan, Fort Rucker, Taylor, Midland City, Level Plains, Newton, New Brockton, Pinckard, Clayhatchee, Coffee Springs, Chancellor, Hollis Dairy Road, Knox Field, Lucile, Gerald, Turner Crossroads, Central City and Clintonville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
